resources.string: "For ShakeSafe to work properly, please leave the app open in the background. The app will only upload data when the phone's screen is off and laying on a flat surface."
The map below displays earthquakes around the world with magnitudes greater than 4.5, that were reported within the last day. This data was extracted from USGS.
Go into Settings > Search for: Battery optimization > Select All apps > Find ShakeSafe and disable battery optimization.
Location permissions are required to know where vibrations are uploaded from, to effectively find an epicenter.
To distinguish uploads between this device and others, a unique ID will be used and stored locally in memory. The app will automatically assign this device an ID.

Earthquake detection on mobile devices is made possible by sensing changes in vibrations using the accelerometer. To use the accelerometer when the phone screen is off, Battery Optimization MUST BE DISABLED. SHAKESAFE WILL NOT WORK IF THIS IS NOT DISABLED. The entire functionality of the app resides in the ability to run in the background. If optimization is not disabled, the Android OS will suspend the app when the phone screen is off, which disables uploads and renders the app useless. Please disable this optimization for the app to work properly.
